{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Card[source]

Card(suit=0, rank=2)

Represents a standard playing card.

Attributes: suit: integer 0-3 rank: integer 1-13

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Card is a class that represents a single card in a deck of cards. For example:

{% raw %} 
Card(suit=2, rank=11)

Jack of Hearts
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
c = Card(suit=1, rank=3)
assert str(c) == '3 of Diamonds'

c2 = Card(suit=2, rank=11)
assert str(c2) == 'Jack of Hearts'
{% endraw %}

You can do comparisons of cards, too!

{% raw %} 
assert c2 > c
{% endraw %}

{% include note.html content='Look at fastcore’s testing utilities for convenience functions that print out helpful error messages by default when there is an error. These convenience functions are an improvement upon using assert.' %}

You can show the docs for methods by calling show_doc. For example, the code show_doc(Card.__eq__) produces the following documentation:

{% raw %}

Card.__eq__[source]

Card.__eq__(other)

Checks whether self and other have the same rank and suit.

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
card1 = Card(suit=1, rank=3)
card2 = Card(suit=1, rank=3)
assert card1 == card2
{% endraw %}
